item.title: Send Frame issues
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

            [code]
            item = 995;
            c.getPA().sendFrame164(1743);
     	c.getPA().sendFrame246(13716, 190, item);//995 is the item id
 		c.getPA().sendFrame126("\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n"+c.getItems().getItemName(item)+"", 13717);[/code]

AnD drub, the sendFrame164 sends the interface to the chatBox, doing that would make it it show on your gamescreen DINK-HOLE

Read full topic

item.title: Send Frame issues
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

well first things first, when you are using interfaces, you’d want to make sure you make it either a walkable or non walkable interface, and it seems from first glance, that 8880 is the id for the fletching interface, thats probably why it always comes up

Read full topic

item.title: Send Frame issues
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

I have been fighting with making an interface for cooking, and I can not seem to get it, I don’t quite understand on how send frames work, and how to make the send frames create an interface, like here is an example, I made a command to make testing easier, the command is,

        if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("Sendframe")) {
        	c.getPA().sendFrame164(8880);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("", 84875);
            c.getPA().sendFrame246(4878, 250, 996);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("", 47784);
        }

But it displays the fletching interface (lol) How would I go about fixing this?

Read full topic
